definition: easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: She always drank it out of the can, I should have known.
sentences.chinese: 她總是直接用易拉罐喝，我應該早發現了。

sentences.english: He had helped to design the petrol engine, and plastics, and the ring pull can.
sentences.chinese: 他曾經協助過設計汽油發動機，塑料和易拉罐。

sentences.english: In addition, of Japan pull coal tub dish easily to wait to already also swarmed into our country market.
sentences.chinese: 此外，日本的易拉罐菜等也已湧入我國市場。

sentences.english: Now, I will heat the water in the soda can on the stove until it boils.
sentences.chinese: 接着，將易拉罐放在火爐上加熱至其沸騰。

sentences.english: We sort our pop cans, beer bottles and waste paper.
sentences.chinese: 我們整理易拉罐，啤酒瓶和廢紙。

sentences.english: Use a soda can to collect and store rainwater.
sentences.chinese: 這時可以用易拉罐收集並存儲雨水。

sentences.english: Crops in the woods a found cans.
sentences.chinese: 耕一在樹林發現了易拉罐。

sentences.english: The boy beat out a tune on a tin can.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩在易拉罐上敲出一首曲子。

definition: ring pull (can)/strap handle (on bus or train)/circular door handle
carton (e.g. for milk or juice)/Tetra Pak
